Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ : RYAAY ) Shares Sold by M&T Bank Corp
Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Shares Sold by M&T Bank Corp
American Banking and Market News
May 3, 2022 Tuesday
Copyright 2022 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 764 words
Body
Ryanair M&T Bank Corp decreased its stake in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) 
by 15.2% in the 4th quarter, according to its most recent Form 13F filing with the SEC. The fund owned 2,643 
shares of the transportation company's stock after selling 472 shares during the period. M&T Bank Corp's holdings 
in Ryanair were worth $270,000 at the end of the most recent reporting period.  
Other hedge funds also recently modified their holdings of the company. Assetmark Inc. increased its position in  
Ryanair by 133.6% during the third quarter. Assetmark Inc. now owns 271 shares of the transportation company's 
stock worth $30,000 after purchasing an additional 155 shares during the last quarter.  JFS Wealth Advisors LLC 
purchased a new stake in  Ryanair during the third quarter worth approximately $47,000.  Fifth Third Bancorp grew 
its stake in  Ryanair by 1,124.4% during the fourth quarter. Fifth Third Bancorp now owns 551 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $56,000 after buying an additional 506 shares during the period.  Rockefeller 
Capital Management L.P. grew its stake in  Ryanair by 29.8% during the third quarter. Rockefeller Capital 
Management L.P. now owns 714 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $77,000 after buying an 
additional 164 shares during the period.  Finally, Migdal Insurance & Financial Holdings Ltd. purchased a new stake 
in  Ryanair during the third quarter worth approximately $91,000.  
Several research analysts have recently weighed in on RYAAY shares. Morgan Stanley decreased their target price 
on shares of Ryanair from  21.00 ($22.11) to  20.00 ($21.05) in a research note on Tuesday, March 29th. UBS 
Group upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to a "buy" rating in a research note on Tuesday, April 
12th. Liberum Capital upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research note on 
Wednesday, January 19th. Raymond James decreased their target price on shares of Ryanair from $138.00 to 
$125.00 and set an "outperform" rating for the company in a research note on Monday, April 25th. Finally, Zacks 
Investment Research  upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating and set a $114.00 target 
price for the company in a research note on Friday, February 18th. Five analysts have rated the stock with a hold 
rating and thirteen have given a buy rating to the company. According to data from MarketBeat, the company 
currently has an average rating of "Buy" and a consensus price target of $83.16. 
RYAAY  opened at $87.53 on Tuesday. The stock has a market capitalization of $19.86 billion, a PE ratio of -38.06 
and a beta of 1.48. The firm's fifty day moving average price is $88.85 and its 200 day moving average price is 
$102.72. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.93, a current ratio of 1.28 and a quick ratio of 1.28. Ryanair 
Holdings plc has a 12-month low of $74.12 and a 12-month high of $127.25.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) last issued its earnings results on Monday, January 31st. The 
transportation company reported ($0.48) earnings per share for the quarter, missing the Zacks' consensus estimate 
Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ : RYAAY ) Shares Sold by M&T Bank Corp
of ($0.47) by ($0.01). The business had revenue of $1.68 billion for the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of 
$1.79 billion. Ryanair had a negative return on equity of 9.89% and a negative net margin of 11.77%.  On average, 
equities research analysts forecast that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post -1.87 earnings per share for the current fiscal 
year.  
Ryanair Profile (Get Rating ) 
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing of car hire and accommodation services, and travel insurance through its website and 
mobile app.

the stock with a hold rating and thirteen have assigned a buy rating to the stock. According to data from

ratio of 1.28 and a current ratio of 1.28. The stock has a market capitalization of $19.86 billion, a price-to-earnings

ratio of -38.06 and a beta of 1.48. The company has a fifty day moving average of $88.85 and a 200-day moving 
average of $102.72. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52-week low of $74.12 and a 52-week high of $127.25.

transportation company reported ($0.48) EPS for the quarter, missing the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of 
($0.47) by ($0.01). Ryanair had a negative return on equity of 9.89% and a negative net margin of 11.77%. The 
company had revenue of $1.68 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $1.79 billion. On 
average, equities research analysts forecast that Ryanair Holdings plc will post -1.87 earnings per share for the 
current fiscal year.  
About Ryanair (Get Rating[8]) 
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing of car hire and accommodation services, and travel insurance through its website and 
mobile app.

Heathrow boss at odds with airlines as battle over landing fees hots up Airport accused of 'cynical' attempt to 
drive up charges with downbeat assessment of rec....
Heathrow boss at odds with airlines as battle over landing fees hots up; 
Airport accused of 'cynical' attempt to drive up charges with downbeat 
assessment of recovery
Financial Times (London, England)
May 3, 2022 Tuesday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2022 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; Pg. 10
Length: 817 words
Byline: PHILIP GEORGIADIS
Body
For a time in the spring, John Holland-Kaye, Heathrow chief executive, was mucking in on the front line, stacking X-
ray trays at security to help keep queues moving at the short-staffed airport.
Like the rest of the travel industry, the airport has roared back to life following two desperate years in which border 
restrictions stifled business.
But Holland-Kaye is already into his next fight. Britain's busiest airport - which has suffered £4bn of losses since the 
start of 2020 - has caused a rift in the travel industry by pushing for a 90 per cent rise in the landing fees it charges. 
It has enraged airlines, which have also suffered billions of dollars in losses and run up large debts during the 
pandemic.
The antipathy deepened this week when Holland-Kaye unveiled a downbeat assessment of the industry's recovery, 
warning that the surge in demand for travel this spring and summer was a "bubble" that might pop this winter.
The view contrasts with a burst of positive commentary from other parts of the industry. IAG, owner of British 
Airways, has said a "strong and sustained" recovery is under way. Holland- Kaye's comments have fuelled 
Heathrow boss at odds with airlines as battle over landing fees hots up Airport accused of 'cynical' attempt to 
drive up charges with downbeat assessment of rec....
accusations from airlines that he is talking down the recovery in order to persuade the regulator to allow Heathrow 
to increase its fees, which are charged on a per passenger basis.
Virgin Atlantic said Heathrow was putting out "cynical forecasts and conflicting statements", while the airlines trade 
body said the airport was "trying to drive up charges to support shareholder returns". Holland-Kaye said that he was 
offering an honest assessment of an uncertain future.
Heathrow does not forecast a return to profit or dividends this year.
Holland-Kaye said last week: "I think we are more realistic, and we have been throughout the pandemic ... It reflects 
the reality of the world we are living in."
The battle over fees has, on occasion, become personal.
Holland-Kaye was forced to step down from a Department for Transport recruitment panel this year following a 
backlash from airlines, which objected to his involvement as they argued over fees.
Figures including Ryanair boss Michael O'Leary and former BA boss Willie Walsh have delighted in berating 
Heathrow.
To its detractors, the airport is a monopoly that abuses its position to charge some of the highest fees. To its 
supporters, it is a vital trade and economic hub that should be allowed to charge more to invest and keep pace with 
European rivals after it was briefly overtaken as the region's busiest airport during the pandemic.
Unlike many airline bosses, Holland-Kaye is not an industry lifer.
He joined Heathrow in 2009 after working in the housebuilding industry, including at Taylor Wimpey and Taylor 
Woodrow, and before that for a brewery and for LEK, a consultancy.
Holland-Kaye worked for five years in commercial and development roles at the airport before taking over as chief 
executive. This included overseeing the launch of the revamped Terminal 2, which was considerably more 
successful than the debacle when Terminal 5, the home of BA, opened 15 years ago amid chaos and technical 
failures.
The married father of two, who was paid £1.5mn in 2021, became Heathrow's boss in 2014, a position whose 
holder must navigate a string of politically and commercially sensitive issues.
Executives at Heathrow have argued that clashes with airlines over regulation and costs are inevitable.
Holland-Kaye has taken a lower-key approach than Walsh or O'Leary, although he did become the public face of 
the battle to build a third runway, which has pitted Heathrow against the communities surrounding it and local 
politicians.
A planning battle looms over the expansion, which Heathrow put back on the table this year, having methodically 
pushed through the process to secure political and legal approval.
Heathrow has long had a fractious relationship with the airline industry, particularly British Airways, its largest 
customer. But industry figures said Holland-Kaye worked well with Sean Doyle, BA chief executive, and the pair 
were in virtually daily contact during the pandemic, including joint pushes to persuade ministers to lift travel 
restrictions. They staged a photo shoot on one of Heathrow's closed runways to highlight the industry's struggles, 
along with Shai Weiss, boss of Virgin Atlantic.
The relationships Holland-Kaye has worked to build are about to be tested perhaps more than ever.
The Civil Aviation Authority will rule on how much Heathrow can charge to land at the airport later this year, and 
many industry executives expect the decision to be taken to appeal whichever way it goes.
Heathrow boss at odds with airlines as battle over landing fees hots up Airport accused of 'cynical' attempt to 
drive up charges with downbeat assessment of rec....
One industry executive said Holland-Kaye had won goodwill for his efforts to persuade the government to drop its 
travel rules, but had "smashed that all" by trying to raise fees at such a delicate moment.
'I think we are more realistic ... It reflects the reality of the world we are living in'
Graphic
 
Passengers arrive at Heathrow, where CEO John Holland-Kaye, below, is seeking a large increase in landing fees 
Justin Tallis/AFP via Getty
Load-Date: May 2, 2022
End of Document
Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ : RYAAY ) Shares Sold by Mitsubishi UFJ Trust & Banking Corp
Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Shares Sold by Mitsubishi UFJ 
Trust & Banking Corp
Newstex Blogs 
DailyPolitical
May 2, 2022 Monday 3:20 PM EST
Copyright 2022 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 1250 words
Body
May 02, 2022( DailyPolitical: http://www.dailypolitical.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 Mitsubishi UFJ Trust & Banking Corp trimmed its position in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] - 
Get Rating[2]) by 0.1% during the fourth quarter, according to its most recent Form 13F filing with the Securities & 
Exchange Commission. The institutional investor owned 932,554 shares of the transportation company's stock after 
selling 1,290 shares during the period. Mitsubishi UFJ Trust & Banking Corp owned approximately 0.41% of 
Ryanair worth $95,428,000 as of its most recent SEC filing.  
Other large investors have also recently added to or reduced their stakes in the company. Assetmark Inc. lifted its 
stake in Ryanair by 133.6% during the third quarter. Assetmark Inc. now owns 271 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $30,000 after purchasing an additional 155 shares in the last quarter. JFS Wealth Advisors 
LLC acquired a new stake in shares of Ryanair in the third quarter valued at $47,000. Fifth Third Bancorp raised its 
stake in shares of Ryanair by 1,124.4% in the fourth quarter. Fifth Third Bancorp now owns 551 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $56,000 after acquiring an additional 506 shares in the last quarter. 
Rockefeller Capital Management L.P. raised its stake in shares of Ryanair by 29.8% in the third quarter. Rockefeller 
Capital Management L.P. now owns 714 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $77,000 after 
acquiring an additional 164 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Migdal Insurance & Financial Holdings Ltd. acquired a 
new stake in shares of Ryanair in the third quarter valued at $91,000.  
Shares of NASDAQ RYAAY[3] traded up $0.06 during midday trading on Monday, reaching $87.38. 1,235 shares of 
the company were exchanged, compared to its average volume of 616,070. The company has a current ratio of 
1.28, a quick ratio of 1.28 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.93. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 1 year low of $74.12 and a 
1 year high of $127.25. The stock has a fifty day simple moving average of $89.23 and a 200 day simple moving 
average of $102.93. The stock has a market cap of $19.83 billion, a P/E ratio of -37.97 and a beta of 1.48.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[4] - Get Rating[5]) last released its quarterly earnings results on Monday, January 31st. 
The transportation company reported ($0.48) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the Zacks' 
consensus estimate of ($0.47) by ($0.01). Ryanair had a negative return on equity of 9.89% and a negative net 
margin of 11.77%. The company had revenue of $1.68 billion for the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of 
$1.79 billion. As a group, analysts forecast that Ryanair Holdings plc will post -1.87 earnings per share for the 
current year.  
Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ : RYAAY ) Shares Sold by Mitsubishi UFJ Trust & Banking Corp
RYAAY has been the topic of several analyst reports. Morgan Stanley reduced their price objective on Ryanair from 
€21.00 ($22.58) to €20.00 ($21.51) in a research note on Tuesday, March 29th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. raised their 
price target on Ryanair to €21.00 ($22.58) in a research note on Friday, January 21st. Raymond James cut their 
price target on Ryanair from $138.00 to $125.00 and set an "outperform" rating on the stock in a research note on 
Monday, April 25th. Zacks Investment Research[6] upgraded Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating and set a 
$114.00 price target on the stock in a research note on Friday, February 18th. Finally, Berenberg Bank cut their 
price target on Ryanair from €20.50 ($22.04) to €20.00 ($21.51) in a research note on Wednesday, February 23rd. 
Five analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and thirteen have given a buy rating to the company's stock. 
According to data from MarketBeat, the company currently has an average rating of "Buy" and a consensus price 
target of $83.16. 
Ryanair Company Profile (Get Rating[7]) 
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing of car hire and accommodation services, and travel insurance through its website and 
mobile app.

Brinker Capital Investments LLC Has $3.11 Million Stock Position in Ryanair 
Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY)
Newstex Blogs 
Zolmax.com
May 2, 2022 Monday 1:06 PM EST
Copyright 2022 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 1429 words
Body
May 02, 2022( Zolmax.com: http://www.zolmax.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 Brinker Capital Investments LLC grew its position in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] - Get Rating[2]) by 
11.8% in the 4th quarter, according to the company in its most recent Form 13F filing with the Securities and 
Exchange Commission (SEC). The firm owned 30,385 shares of the transportation company's stock after buying an 
additional 3,211 shares during the quarter. Brinker Capital Investments LLC's holdings in Ryanair were worth 
$3,109,000 at the end of the most recent quarter.  
Several other institutional investors and hedge funds have also recently made changes to their positions in the 
business. Janus Henderson Group PLC boosted its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 0.8% during the third quarter. 
Janus Henderson Group PLC now owns 2,953,810 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$325,096,000 after purchasing an additional 23,924 shares during the period. William Blair Investment 
Management LLC boosted its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 7.1% during the third quarter. William Blair 
Investment Management LLC now owns 2,413,675 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$265,662,000 after purchasing an additional 159,922 shares during the period. Bank of New York Mellon Corp 
boosted its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 1.0% during the third quarter. Bank of New York Mellon Corp now 
owns 1,464,054 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $161,134,000 after purchasing an additional 
14,166 shares during the period. Adelphi Capital LLP boosted its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 4.9% during the 
fourth quarter. Adelphi Capital LLP now owns 1,161,249 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$118,830,000 after purchasing an additional 54,705 shares during the period. Finally, BlackRock Inc. boosted its 
holdings in shares of Ryanair by 26.5% during the third quarter. BlackRock Inc. now owns 1,132,424 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $124,636,000 after purchasing an additional 237,115 shares during the 
period. Institutional investors own 43.59% of the company's stock.  
Several brokerages recently weighed in on RYAAY. Morgan Stanley cut their price objective on shares of Ryanair 
from €21.00 ($22.58) to €20.00 ($21.51) in a research report on Tuesday, March 29th. Raymond James dropped 
their price target on shares of Ryanair from $138.00 to $125.00 and set an "outperform" rating on the stock in a 
research report on Monday, April 25th. Zacks Investment Research[3] raised shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating 
to a "hold" rating and set a $114.00 price target on the stock in a research report on Friday, February 18th. 
StockNews.com[4] began coverage on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Thursday, March 31st. They 
Brinker Capital Investments LLC Has $3.11 Million Stock Position in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ : RYAAY 
)
issued a "hold" rating on the stock. Finally, Sanford C. Bernstein raised shares of Ryanair from a "market perform" 
rating to an "outperform" rating and set a $107.00 target price on the stock in a research report on Tuesday, March 
22nd. Five analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and thirteen have given a buy rating to the company. 
According to data from MarketBeat, the company presently has an average rating of "Buy" and an average target 
price of $83.16. 
Ryanair stock[5] opened at $87.32 on Monday. The stock has a 50-day simple moving average of $89.23 and a 200 
day simple moving average of $102.93. The company has a quick ratio of 1.28, a current ratio of 1.28 and a debt-
to-equity ratio of 0.93. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 12-month low of $74.12 and a 12-month high of $127.25. The 
stock has a market capitalization of $19.81 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of -37.97 and a beta of 1.48.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[6] - Get Rating[7]) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, January 31st. 
The transportation company reported ($0.48) earnings per share for the quarter, missing the Thomson Reuters' 
consensus estimate of ($0.47) by ($0.01). The firm had revenue of $1.68 billion for the quarter, compared to the 
consensus estimate of $1.79 billion. Ryanair had a negative return on equity of 9.89% and a negative net margin of 
11.77%. As a group, sell-side analysts anticipate that Ryanair Holdings plc will post -1.87 EPS for the current year.  
Ryanair Profile (Get Rating[8]) 
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing of car hire and accommodation services, and travel insurance through its website and 
mobile app.

Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ : RYAAY ) Short Interest Up 136.5% in April
Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Short Interest Up 136.5% in April
Newstex Blogs 
Watchlist News
May 1, 2022 Sunday 12:30 PM EST
Copyright 2022 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 1256 words
Body
May 01, 2022( Watchlist News: http://www.watchlistnews.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] - Get Rating[2]) was the recipient of a large increase in short interest in 
the month of April. As of April 15th, there was short interest totalling 636,000 shares, an increase of 136.5% from 
the March 31st total of 268,900 shares. Based on an average trading volume of 688,500 shares, the short-interest 
ratio is currently 0.9 days.  
Shares of NASDAQ:RYAAY[3] opened at $87.32 on Friday. The company has a market capitalization of $19.81 
billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of -37.97 and a beta of 1.48. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.93, a 
current ratio of 1.28 and a quick ratio of 1.28. The business's 50-day moving average is $89.23 and its 200-day 
moving average is $103.03. Ryanair has a 1 year low of $74.12 and a 1 year high of $127.25.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[4] - Get Rating[5]) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, January 31st. 
The transportation company reported ($0.48) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus 
estimates of ($0.47) by ($0.01). The business had revenue of $1.68 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst 
estimates of $1.79 billion. Ryanair had a negative net margin of 11.77% and a negative return on equity of 9.89%. 
Analysts anticipate that Ryanair will post -1.87 EPS for the current year.  
 A number of hedge funds have recently bought and sold shares of RYAAY. Raymond James & Associates raised 
its stake in Ryanair by 68.0% during the 3rd quarter. Raymond James & Associates now owns 112,448 shares of 
the transportation company's stock worth $12,376,000 after buying an additional 45,499 shares during the period. 
Raymond James Financial Services Advisors Inc. raised its stake in Ryanair by 9.8% during the 3rd quarter. 
Raymond James Financial Services Advisors Inc. now owns 3,503 shares of the transportation company's stock 
worth $386,000 after buying an additional 314 shares during the period. Deutsche Bank AG raised its stake in 
Ryanair by 4,603.4% during the 3rd quarter. Deutsche Bank AG now owns 4,092 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $450,000 after buying an additional 4,005 shares during the period. Exencial Wealth 
Advisors LLC acquired a new position in Ryanair during the 3rd quarter worth approximately $961,000. Finally, 
Pendal Group Ltd acquired a new position in Ryanair during the 3rd quarter worth approximately $30,945,000. 
43.59% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors and hedge funds.  
Several equities analysts have recently issued reports on the company. Zacks Investment Research[6] upgraded 
Ryanair from a 'sell' rating to a 'hold' rating and set a $114.00 price target on the stock in a research note on Friday, 
February 18th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. lifted their price target on Ryanair to €21.00 ($22.58) in a research note on 
Friday, January 21st. Raymond James decreased their price target on Ryanair from $138.00 to $125.00 and set an 
Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ : RYAAY ) Short Interest Up 136.5% in April
'outperform' rating on the stock in a research note on Monday, April 25th. Morgan Stanley decreased their price 
target on Ryanair from €21.00 ($22.58) to €20.00 ($21.51) in a research note on Tuesday, March 29th. Finally, UBS 
Group upgraded Ryanair from a 'neutral' rating to a 'buy' rating in a research note on Tuesday, April 12th. Five 
investment analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and thirteen have given a buy rating to the company. 
According to MarketBeat.com, the stock presently has an average rating of 'Buy' and an average target price of 
$83.16. 
Ryanair Company Profile (Get Rating[7]) 
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing of car hire and accommodation services, and travel insurance through its website and 
mobile app.

Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ : RYAAY ) Short Interest Up 136.5% in April
Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Short Interest Up 136.5% in April
American Banking and Market News
May 1, 2022 Sunday
Copyright 2022 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 718 words
Body
Ryanair Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) saw a significant increase in short interest in April. 
As of April 15th, there was short interest totalling 636,000 shares,  an increase of 136.5% from the March 31st total 
of 268,900 shares. Based on an average trading volume of 688,500 shares, the short-interest ratio is currently 0.9 
days.  
NASDAQ:RYAAY  opened at $87.32 on Friday. The company has a market cap of $19.81 billion, a P/E ratio of -
37.97 and a beta of 1.48. The stock's fifty day moving average price is $89.23 and its two-hundred day moving 
average price is $103.03. Ryanair has a 1 year low of $74.12 and a 1 year high of $127.25. The company has a 
debt-to-equity ratio of 0.93, a current ratio of 1.28 and a quick ratio of 1.28.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) last posted its earnings results on Monday, January 31st. The 
transportation company reported ($0.48) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the consensus estimate 
of ($0.47) by ($0.01). Ryanair had a negative return on equity of 9.89% and a negative net margin of 11.77%. The 
company had revenue of $1.68 billion for the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $1.79 billion.  On 
average, analysts expect that  Ryanair will post -1.87 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  
Several equities analysts have recently issued reports on the company. Liberum Capital raised Ryanair from a 
"hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Wednesday, January 19th. Zacks Investment Research  raised Ryanair 
from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating and set a $114.00 target price for the company in a report on Friday, February 
18th. Berenberg Bank dropped their price objective on Ryanair from  20.50 ($22.04) to  20.00 ($21.51) in a 
research note on Wednesday, February 23rd. UBS Group upgraded Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to a "buy" rating 
in a research note on Tuesday, April 12th. Finally, Raymond James dropped their price objective on Ryanair from 
$138.00 to $125.00 and set an "outperform" rating on the stock in a research note on Monday, April 25th. Five 
investment analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and thirteen have issued  a buy rating to the company's 
stock. Based on data from MarketBeat, Ryanair  has a consensus rating of "Buy" and an average price target of 
$83.16. 
Several hedge funds have recently modified their holdings of RYAAY. Raymond James & Associates raised its 
position in shares of  Ryanair by 68.0% in the third quarter. Raymond James & Associates now owns 112,448 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $12,376,000 after buying an additional 45,499 shares in the last 
quarter.  Raymond James Financial Services Advisors Inc. raised its position in shares of  Ryanair by 9.8% in the 
third quarter. Raymond James Financial Services Advisors Inc. now owns 3,503 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $386,000 after buying an additional 314 shares in the last quarter.  Deutsche Bank AG 
raised its position in shares of  Ryanair by 4,603.4% in the third quarter. Deutsche Bank AG now owns 4,092 
Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ : RYAAY ) Short Interest Up 136.5% in April
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $450,000 after buying an additional 4,005 shares in the last 
quarter.  Exencial Wealth Advisors LLC purchased a new stake in shares of  Ryanair in the third quarter worth 
$961,000.  Finally, Pendal Group Ltd purchased a new stake in shares of  Ryanair in the third quarter worth 
$30,945,000. Institutional investors own  43.59% of the company's stock.  
About Ryanair (Get Rating ) 
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing of car hire and accommodation services, and travel insurance through its website and 
mobile app.

Ryanair Mitsubishi UFJ Kokusai Asset Management Co. Ltd. grew its position in  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) by 97.6% during the fourth quarter, according to its most recent Form 13F filing 
with the SEC. The firm owned 1,083 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an additional 
535 shares during the period. Mitsubishi UFJ Kokusai Asset Management Co. Ltd.'s holdings in Ryanair were worth 
$115,000 at the end of the most recent quarter.  
Several other hedge funds have also recently made changes to their positions in RYAAY. Assetmark Inc. grew its

company's stock worth $30,000 after acquiring an additional 155 shares during the period.  JFS Wealth Advisors

holdings in  Ryanair by 1,124.4% during the fourth quarter. Fifth Third Bancorp now owns 551 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $56,000 after acquiring an additional 506 shares during the period.

Capital Management L.P. now owns 714 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $77,000 after 
acquiring an additional 164 shares during the period.  Finally, Migdal Insurance & Financial Holdings Ltd. acquired a 
new stake in  Ryanair during the third quarter worth about $91,000. 43.59% of the stock is currently owned by 
institutional investors and hedge funds.  
RYAAY has been the topic of a number of recent analyst reports. Berenberg Bank lowered their price target on 
Ryanair from  20.50 ($22.04) to  20.00 ($21.51) in a research report on Wednesday, February 23rd. Wolfe 
Research downgraded Ryanair from an "outperform" rating to a "peer perform" rating in a research report on 
Wednesday, January 12th. UBS Group upgraded Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to a "buy" rating in a research 
report on Tuesday, April 12th. Sanford C. Bernstein upgraded Ryanair from a "market perform" rating to an 
"outperform" rating and set a $107.00 price target on the stock in a research report on Tuesday, March 22nd. 
Finally, Liberum Capital upgraded Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research report on Wednesday, 
January 19th. Five equities research analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and thirteen have issued  a 
buy rating to the company. According to MarketBeat.com, the stock  has a consensus rating of "Buy" and an 
average price target of $83.16. 
Shares of Ryanair stock  opened at $87.32 on Friday. Ryanair Holdings plc has a one year low of $74.12 and a one 
year high of $127.25. The company has a market cap of $19.81 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of -37.97 and a

Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, January 31st. The 
transportation company reported ($0.48) EPS for the quarter, missing the Zacks' consensus estimate of ($0.47) by

Body

Get Rating ) by 16.1% during the fourth quarter, according to its most recent disclosure with the Securities & 
Exchange Commission. The firm owned 2,566 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an 
additional 356 shares during the period. Mercer Global Advisors Inc. ADV's holdings in Ryanair were worth 
$263,000 as of its most recent SEC filing.

Wealth Advisors LLC grew its position in shares of  Ryanair by 4.6% during the fourth quarter. 180 Wealth Advisors 
LLC now owns 2,584 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $293,000 after buying an additional 113 
shares in the last quarter.  First Republic Investment Management Inc. grew its position in shares of  Ryanair by 
3.5% during the third quarter. First Republic Investment Management Inc. now owns 3,975 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $437,000 after buying an additional 134 shares in the last quarter.  Raymond 
James Trust N.A. grew its position in shares of  Ryanair by 5.0% during the fourth quarter. Raymond James Trust 
N.A. now owns 2,930 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $300,000 after buying an additional 139 
shares in the last quarter.  Assetmark Inc. grew its position in shares of  Ryanair by 133.6% during the third quarter. 
Assetmark Inc. now owns 271 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $30,000 after buying an 
additional 155 shares in the last quarter.  Finally, Rockefeller Capital Management L.P. grew its position in shares 
of  Ryanair by 29.8% during the third quarter. Rockefeller Capital Management L.P. now owns 714 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $77,000 after buying an additional 164 shares in the last quarter. Institutional 
investors own  43.59% of the company's stock.  
Shares of Ryanair stock  opened at $87.32 on Friday. The company has a current ratio of 1.28, a quick ratio of 1.28 
and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.93. The company's 50-day moving average price is $89.23 and its two-hundred day 
moving average price is $103.03. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52 week low of $74.12 and a 52 week high of 
$127.25. The stock has a market cap of $19.81 billion, a PE ratio of -37.97 and a beta of 1.48.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) last posted its quarterly earnings data on Monday, January 31st. The 
transportation company reported ($0.48) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the Thomson Reuters' 
consensus estimate of ($0.47) by ($0.01). The company had revenue of $1.68 billion for the quarter, compared to 
analyst estimates of $1.79 billion. Ryanair had a negative return on equity of 9.89% and a negative net margin of 
11.77%.  On average, equities analysts predict that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post -1.87 EPS for the current fiscal 
year.

A number of equities analysts have commented on RYAAY shares. StockNews.com  started coverage on shares of 
Ryanair in a report on Thursday, March 31st. They issued a "hold" rating for the company. Liberum Capital raised 
shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Wednesday, January 19th. Wolfe Research 
downgraded shares of Ryanair from an "outperform" rating to a "peer perform" rating in a report on Wednesday, 
January 12th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. lifted their price objective on shares of Ryanair to  21.00 ($22.58) in a report 
on Friday, January 21st. Finally, Zacks Investment Research  raised shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a 
"hold" rating and set a $114.00 price objective for the company in a report on Friday, February 18th. Five analysts 
have rated the stock with a hold rating and thirteen have issued  a buy rating to the stock. According to data from 
MarketBeat, the company currently has an average rating of "Buy" and an average price target of $83.16. 
Ryanair Company Profile (Get Rating ) 
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing of car hire and accommodation services, and travel insurance through its website and 
mobile app.

Envestnet Asset Management Inc. Trims Stock Position in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ : RYAAY )
Envestnet Asset Management Inc. Trims Stock Position in Ryanair Holdings 
plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
May 1, 2022 Sunday
Copyright 2022 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 840 words
Body
Ryanair Envestnet Asset Management Inc. lessened its holdings in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) by 0.7% in the 4th quarter, according to the company in its most recent Form 13F 
filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The fund owned 94,542 shares of the transportation 
company's stock after selling 689 shares during the period. Envestnet Asset Management Inc.'s holdings in Ryanair 
were worth $9,674,000 as of its most recent filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).  
Several other institutional investors have also modified their holdings of the stock. 180 Wealth Advisors LLC raised 
its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 4.6% during the fourth quarter. 180 Wealth Advisors LLC now owns 2,584 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $293,000 after purchasing an additional 113 shares during the 
last quarter.  First Republic Investment Management Inc. raised its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 3.5% during 
the third quarter. First Republic Investment Management Inc. now owns 3,975 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $437,000 after purchasing an additional 134 shares during the last quarter.  Raymond 
James Trust N.A. grew its position in  Ryanair by 5.0% during the fourth quarter. Raymond James Trust N.A. now 
owns 2,930 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $300,000 after buying an additional 139 shares 
during the period.  Assetmark Inc. grew its position in  Ryanair by 133.6% during the third quarter. Assetmark Inc. 
now owns 271 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $30,000 after buying an additional 155 
shares during the period.  Finally, Rockefeller Capital Management L.P. grew its position in  Ryanair by 29.8% 
during the third quarter. Rockefeller Capital Management L.P. now owns 714 shares of the transportation 
company's stock valued at $77,000 after buying an additional 164 shares during the period. 43.59% of the stock is 
owned by hedge funds and other institutional investors.  
RYAAY  opened at $87.32 on Friday. The firm has a market capitalization of $19.81 billion, a PE ratio of -37.97 and 
a beta of 1.48. Ryanair Holdings plc has a twelve month low of $74.12 and a twelve month high of $127.25. The 
firm's 50-day moving average price is $89.23 and its 200 day moving average price is $103.03. The company has a 
current ratio of 1.28, a quick ratio of 1.28 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.93.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) last issued its earnings results on Monday, January 31st. The 
transportation company reported ($0.48) EPS for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus estimates of ($0.47) by 
($0.01). Ryanair had a negative return on equity of 9.89% and a negative net margin of 11.77%. The firm had 
revenue of $1.68 billion for the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $1.79 billion.  As a group, analysts 
predict that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post -1.87 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.

Rating ) by 3.2% during the 4th quarter, according to its most recent 13F filing with the Securities & Exchange

Air Europa to expands with 737-800s
Air Europa to expands with 737-800s
AirFinance Journal
May 2022
Copyright 2022 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 296 words
Byline: Olivier Bonnassies
Body
Air Europa is set to start its expansion phase in the second quarter of this year by offering an increase in 
destinations from its Madrid hub and by acquiring a total of 11 aircraft.
The Spanish carrier plans to operate 33 routes in Spain and Europe this year and the short- and medium-haul fleet 
will be supported by the lease of six Boeing 737-800s.
Sources confirm to Airfinance Journal that a pair of aircraft managed by Stratos will join the fleet. 
SMBC Aviation Capital is rumoured to be placing three ex-Ryanair and Ukraine International 737-800s with the 
Spanish carrier while the final aircraft is a 737-800 leased from Aircastle, that was previously operated by TUI.
The narrowbodies will be added progressively over the coming months, said Air Europa.
Air Europa's expansion will reinforce its strategic role in Madrid. Capacity for the second quarter will be 5% up on 
pre-Covid-19 levels, said the carrier.
"The data confirms a significant recovery in activity in recent months, especially in the long-haul sector. The 
increase in passenger demand has allowed the reactivation of routes from Madrid-Barajas, exceeding 2019 levels 
and once again demonstrating the importance of the company in the air corridor between Europe and America."
Throughout 2022, a total of 23 destinations will be offered in the Americas, in addition to the domestic and 
European network.
To achieve international growth plans, the carrier will also take delivery of five 787s, four of which are under a 
sublease agreement with long-haul low-cost start-up Norse Atlantic Airways. Both parties signed a term sheet 
earlier this month for two 787-8s and two 787-9s under an 18-month agreement.
Stratos was unavailable for comment. SMBC Aviation Capital could not confirm the placements at press time.
Load-Date: May 30, 2022
Air Europa to expands with 737-800s
End of Document
Aercap encouraged by demand recovery
Aercap encouraged by demand recovery
AirFinance Journal
May 2022
Copyright 2022 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 562 words
Byline: Laura Mueller
Body
Aercap's chief describes an operating environment of improving demand, increasing utilisation of assets and 
strengthening airline financial health as countries remove the last of the Covid-related travel restriction and 
welcome back travellers.
"The reopening of air travel continues to gather momentum around the world. Despite the uncertainty created by 
the war in Ukraine and higher oil prices, the demand for aircraft is strong," said Aercap's chief executive officer 
Aengus Kelly on a first-quarter earnings call.  
While there is still "quite a way to run" on a full recovery to 2019 levels, he says the only impediment to getting there 
is government intervention. "Once restrictions are scaled back, people return to the skies quickly and in large 
numbers."
This improved operating environment is giving airline chiefs confidence.
"When I speak to airline CEOs, I hear a consistent message: demand is strong enough in the US and Europe to 
pass through higher input costs."
The demand side of the industry continues to improve, with global flight traffic back to 75% of 2019 levels, with 
North America leading the charge at 24,000 daily flights. Europe also continues to improve, heading into the 
summer with 20,000 daily flights.
He references Ryanair as a "very visible example" of this improving operating environment.  
"Ryanair carried one million passengers in April 2021, but in April 2022, it carried 14.2 million passengers or a 14x 
increase."
China is the only major market where significant restrictions remain; however, he does not believe the move will be 
"long-lasting".  
"As we have seen over the past two years, they tend to shut down and reopen very quickly."
His conversations with airline CEOs in Southeast Asia have been "far more upbeat" since the 1st of April as "they 
are seeing booking surge from where they were just a couple of months ago".
Aercap encouraged by demand recovery
The says the CEOs are most focused on the logistics of reopening, particularly how to reactivate their fleets. "We 
can see clear evidence of this in the maintenance and overhaul facilities, where there is little to no capacity left for 
engine overhauls that are required to reactivate aircraft that have been stored for some time. This gives me 
confidence in the demand side for the years to come."
Tourist markets in Southeast Asia, India and Australia are open to international travel and this "bodes well for 
widebody demand" as these are "key" markets for Western Europe, he says.  
"The impact of these announcements is immediate. In just one example, Changi Airport in Singapore saw traffic 
return to 40% of 2019 levels, from just 15% in three months, as a result of this easing, and we see similar results 
elsewhere, with Asia-Pacific, x-China traffic back to 70% of 2019 levels or 16,000 daily flights."
He also notes a strengthening in demand for aircraft sales as the effects of covid-19 begin to ease. "Investors are 
very interested in owning physical assets to provide protection in a higher inflationary environment supporting both 
aircraft and engine values. "
For the fiscal year 2022, Aercap expects to generate between $6.50 and $7.00 of adjusted EPS and approximately 
$5 billion of operating cash flow, excluding the impact of the charge it has taken as a result of the war in Ukraine. 
This result is after considering the 33 million of ongoing lost monthly revenue from the former Russian customers.
Load-Date: June 6, 2022
End of Document
Phenomenal lessor response to 50-aircraft RFP: Ryanair
Phenomenal lessor response to 50-aircraft RFP: Ryanair
AirFinance Journal
May 2022
Copyright 2022 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 357 words
Byline: Olivier bonnassies
Body
Ryanair has reported huge interest in a surprise request for proposals (RFP) for up to 50 used narrowbodies.
"With the exception of the oldest aircraft, lessors are not exposed to Ryanair, which is possibly why we have seen 
such a phenomenal response to the RFP on NGs," said chief financial officer Neil Sorahan on an earnings call.
With plans to fly 225 million passengers per year within five years, Ryanair issued the RFP for up to 50 second-
hand aircraft.
Ryanair recorded 97 million passengers in its 2022 financial year, but plans 165 million in the 2023, 185 million in 
2024, 205 million in 2025 and 225 million in the 2026 financial year.
O'Leary said Ryanair is in advanced discussion with a number of lessors, and Boeing, for second-hand aircraft.
He commented: "What is important to emphasise is we don't need new aircraft to hit our 225 million passenger 
target by 2026 but we remain open and available. We are looking for aircraft opportunities to cover that period 
between 2026 and 2030. We are in the market with a proposal for second-hand Boeing and Airbus aircraft and we 
will see what comes up from those discussions."
Sorahan said the original plan for this summer was to operate a 65-unit 737-8200 fleet but Boeing managed to 
commit to an extra five deliveries.
The group is looking to add 55 or more aircraft for summer 2023 from its 210-aircraft delivery pipeline but is also 
seeking second-hand aircraft.
O'Leary commented: "The management of Boeing is facing significant challenges. We have been disappointed with 
the responses we have received over the last 12 months. We broke the negotiations on the Max 10 order last 
September. In the intervening period, what we have seen is more Boeing customers signing for Airbus aircraft. 
Boeing needs to fight back, needs to win back some of that market share.
"They still produce very good aircraft. There are challenges with aircraft deliveries and we are continuing to struggle 
to get deliveries of aircraft on time," he added.
Phenomenal lessor response to 50-aircraft RFP: Ryanair
"I think Boeing, certainly on the commercial aircraft, needs to up its game. We need to see more deliveries from 
Boeing for larger customers like Ryanair."
Load-Date: June 6, 2022
End of Document
Ryanair cautiously optimistic after reduced loss
Ryanair cautiously optimistic after reduced loss
AirFinance Journal
May 2022
Copyright 2022 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 560 words
Byline: Olivier Bonnassies
Body
Ryanair has a mixed outlook after reducing its loss by almost two-third in the financial year to 31 March 2022 to 
(EURO)355 million ($372 million).
While bookings have improved in recent weeks, the booking curve remains much closer-in than was typical (pre-
Covid) at this time of year, said the carrier.
The damaging impact of the Omicron variant, and Russia's invasion of Ukraine in February means that first quarter 
(April to June period) pricing continues to need stimulation, it said.    Ryanair said average fares were down 27% to 
just (EURO)27 in its financial year while ancillary revenue generated more than (EURO)22 per passenger.
The group acknowledges a pent-up demand for air travel and is cautiously optimistic that peak summer 2022 fares 
will be somewhat ahead of peak summer 2019 (pre-Covid) levels.    Unit cost per passenger (excluding fuel) fell to 
(EURO)35.    Ryanair plans to return to "modest profitability" in the 12-month period to 31 March 2023, despite 
limited first-half visibility and almost zero second-half visibility.    It plans to grow financial year 2023 traffic to 165 
million (up from 97 million in financial year 2022 and 149 million pre-Covid) and will pursue its load-active, yield-
passive strategy to achieve this growth.
While 80% of Ryanair's fuel requirements are hedged well below current spot prices of over $100 per barrel, its 
unhedged 20% will give rise to some unbudgeted cost increases, it warned.   Up to March 2022, Ryanair had taken 
delivery of 61 Boeing 737-8200 aircraft and it hopes to increase this to over 70 new aircraft for peak summer 2022 
(more than the 65 previously targeted) to facilitate recovery and growth opportunities. It plans to add 55 737-8200s 
for summer 2023.   Ryanair scheduled revenues increased 156% to (EURO)2.65 billion in the 12-month period to 
31 March 2022.   For the 12-month period to 31 March 2022, total revenues increased by over 190% to (EURO)4.8 
billion but operating costs reached (EURO)5.27 billion.    EBITDAR was (EURO)276 million and adjusted net 
debt/EBITDAR was 8.8x in financial year 2022.   Ryanair is committed to the gradual restoration of pay cuts this 
financial year. The group said it will start in July this year on a three-year restoration. It is in negotiations with cabin 
crew unions to accelerate the restoration process.
"If we get back to pre-Covid profitability in FY 2023, we will accelerate year 2 and year 3 and will restore fully the 
pay cuts," commented chief executive officer Michael O'Leary.   Zero debt goal
Ryanair cautiously optimistic after reduced loss
Long-term debt fell to (EURO)300 million during the 12-month period, to (EURO)5.1 billion. Year-end net debt fell to 
(EURO)1.45 billion (prior-year (EURO)2.28 billion), while over 90% of the group's fleet of Boeing 737 aircraft is 
unencumbered.    Ryanair plans to reduce this net debt to zero over the next two years, despite peak capital 
expenditure during that time.    At 31 March, Ryanair's cash position was (EURO)3.6 billion, up from (EURO)3.2 
billion at the end of the previous financial year.
In financial year 2022 aircraft and maintenance capital expenditure (capex) reached (EURO)1.2 billion and the 
Group is planning (EURO)2.3 billion Capex in financial year 2023. According to Sorahan, Capex will drop 
to between (EURO)2.1 billion to (EURO)2.2 billion the following year and will strike back quite significantly 
thereafter.
Load-Date: June 6, 2022
